meanings.definition: To become brown or darken in color.
meanings.sent1: After hours in the sun, my skin will imbrown.
meanings.sent2: The leaves imbrown in the autumn season.
meanings.sent3: The bread started to imbrown in the toaster, making it crispy.
meanings.sent4: The once green fields imbrown under the scorching summer heat.
meanings.sent5: The painter used a special technique to imbrown the canvas, giving it an antique look.

meanings.definition: To cause to become brown or darken in color.
meanings.sent1: She will imbrown the chicken by roasting it in the oven.
meanings.sent2: The artist imbrowns the paper by using a tea stain.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally imbrowned the sauce, giving it a rich flavor.
meanings.sent4: The hair dye will imbrown her hair, giving it a natural look.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays imbrown the skin, creating a tan.
